articles.headline: She Said. Then He Said. Now What Will Senators Say?
articles.snippet: Christine Blasey Ford’s harrowing account of a sexual assault brought some women to tears, but Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh angrily proclaimed his innocence.
articles.abstract: Christine Blasey Ford’s harrowing account of a sexual assault brought some women to tears, but Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh angrily proclaimed his innocence.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At the beginning of the day, she was asked if she was sure that he was the one who sexually assaulted her 36 years ago. “One hundred percent,” she said. At the end of the day, he was asked if he was certain he had not. “One hundred percent,” he said.

articles.headline: Brett Kavanaugh and Christine Blasey Ford Duel With Tears and Fury
articles.snippet: At an extraordinary hearing that gripped the country, Dr. Blasey emotionally detailed the night she said Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her.
articles.abstract: At an extraordinary hearing that gripped the country, Dr. Blasey emotionally detailed the night she said Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh and his accuser faced off Thursday in an extraordinary, emotional day of testimony that ricocheted from a woman’s tremulous account of sexual assault to a man’s angry, outraged denial, all of which played out for hours before a riveted nation and a riven Senate.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Tesla Chief Elon Musk Is Sued by S.E.C. in Move That Could Oust Him
articles.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a lawsuit Thursday that accused Mr. Musk, the electric-car manufacturer’s chief executive, of making false and misleading public statements.
articles.abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a lawsuit Thursday that accused Mr. Musk, the electric-car manufacturer’s chief executive, of making false and misleading public statements.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk, Tesla’s chief executive, was accused by federal regulators on Thursday of misleading investors with false public statements, a move that could force him out of the company’s leadership.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Emily Flitter

articles.headline: Meet the Woman in Charge of Building the Best-Selling Pickup Truck in America
articles.snippet: Responsible for overseeing a Ford F-150 plant that she calls “a little city,” Debbie Manzano holds the rare status of being a woman at the helm of a major American production facility.
articles.abstract: Responsible for overseeing a Ford F-150 plant that she calls “a little city,” Debbie Manzano holds the rare status of being a woman at the helm of a major American production facility.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich. — Straight out of college, statistics degree in hand, Debbie Manzano started working for Ford keeping an eye on the glass production process at the company’s massive Rouge complex in Michigan.

articles.headline: A Nation Transfixed as Emotional Testimony in Kavanaugh Hearing Unfolds
articles.snippet: As Christine Blasey Ford and Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh gave their accounts in eight hours of tears, anger and exasperation, it seemed the country could not look away.
articles.abstract: As Christine Blasey Ford and Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh gave their accounts in eight hours of tears, anger and exasperation, it seemed the country could not look away.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLORADO SPRINGS — Travelers on airplanes cried as they watched it on their seatback televisions. College students holed up all day at library computers and streamed it on their phones, drowning out their lectures. Friends sat together, stunned and still, on living room couches. Television screens at nail salons, sports bars and hotel lobbies were tuned to nothing else.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy and Farah Stockman

articles.headline: Trump Agrees to Open ‘Limited’ F.B.I. Investigation Into Accusations Against Kavanaugh
articles.snippet: The investigation must be completed “in less than a week,” the president said, bowing to a request from Senate Republican leaders facing an insurrection in their ranks.
articles.abstract: The investigation must be completed “in less than a week,” the president said, bowing to a request from Senate Republican leaders facing an insurrection in their ranks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, ceding to a request from Senate Republican leaders facing an insurrection in their ranks, ordered the F.B.I. on Friday to reopen a background investigation of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, his nominee to the Supreme Court, and examine the allegations of sexual assault that have been made against him.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

articles.headline: China Censors Bad Economic News Amid Signs of Slower Growth
articles.snippet: New directives betray a mounting anxiety among Chinese leaders that the country could be facing a worsening slump as the trade war with the United States intensifies.
articles.abstract: New directives betray a mounting anxiety among Chinese leaders that the country could be facing a worsening slump as the trade war with the United States intensifies.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China has long made it clear that reporting on politics, civil society and sensitive historical events is forbidden. Increasingly, it wants to keep negative news about the economy under control, too.
articles.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee and Li Yuan
